subject: Football
College Athletics
lead_paragraph: Monte Kiffin, the Tampa Bay Buccaneers’ longtime defensive coordinator, ended weeks of speculation by confirming on Monday that he would leave the N.F.L. at the end of this season for a position on the staff of his son Lane Kiffin at the University of Tennessee. Monte Kiffin is in his 13th season of running the Bucs’ defense. The unit has ranked among the best in the N.F.L. for most of that tenure. ¶Ball State Coach Brady Hoke has resigned to accept the same position at San Diego State. Ball State, Hoke’s alma mater, has gone 12-1 this season, with its only loss coming against Buffalo in the Mid-American Conference championship game. Hoke went 34-38 in six years at the university. hoke.
